Each of these honorary degrees recognise outstanding contributions and achievements to our‚Ä¶
data.text:
We‚Äôre pleased to share our new partnership with Tata Consultancy Services (TCS). Under a new agreement, The University of Warwick will be working with TCS on our IT infrastructure services, enhancing information security and improving the user experience for our staff and students. The new services provided by TCS will incorporate TCS Cognix, a new technology which uses AI to provide 24/7 IT support. Raja Javaid, Warwick‚Äôs Chief Information and Transformation Officer, commented: ‚Äú This is an exciting opportunity to improve our services to our staff and students, whilst also strengthening our information security. By working with TCS, we hope to become one of the few universities to provide 24/7 IT support, leading the way in the flexibility and simplicity of our offering to our community.‚Äù ‚ÄúOur new partnership with TCS strengthens the existing relationship between Warwick and the Tata Group, enabling us to better address complex challenges and stay ahead of the curve in a rapidly evolving digital landscape‚Äù. Amit Kapur, TCS Country Head, UK&I, said, ‚ÄúIt is great to see this partnership with the University of Warwick and our growth in support to the education sector in the UK. Through our new partnership, we will work to accelerate the University‚Äôs approach and ensure that we innovate together to improve the experience for all those engaging with the University‚Äôs services.‚Äù

Kindness, talent and work ethic has earned Fiona Kitchen a well-deserved Warwick Wonder staff award üèÜ Working across Professional Services and academia Fiona goes above and beyond to support her mathematics department and has been pivotal in inspiring school-age students to consider maths in higher education. Stuart Croft, Vice-Chancellor and President of the University of Warwick commented as he presented the award: "Fiona does amazing outreach work, connecting with secondary school students taking level three mathematics courses, encouraging them to carry on with study, working really hard to share opportunities and bring people forward."

üéì Warwick Summer School 2024 üåû What an incredible summer we've had on campus! Across July and August we held three summer school programmes and were joined by just under 300 students and professionals from around the globe! Highlights included: ‚ú®Engaging in thought-provoking lectures by world-class academics in a range of subjects. ‚ú®Joining fun socials and trips to iconic UK cities, creating unforgettable experiences. ‚ú®Experiencing talks and discussions with high-profile guest speakers, including: Welcome talk from Professor Stuart Croft , Vice-Chancellor and President of the University of Warwick. Guest Lectures from Krisi Smith, Co-Founder and Owner of Bird & Blend Tea Co, Satnam Rana-Grindley CIPR, the Director for Communications - Corporate Brand at the University of Warwick and Professor Ciaran Martin, CB, a Professor of Practice at the Blavatnik School of Government at the University of Oxford. Did you join us this year? We can‚Äôt wait to do it all again next year, 2025 applications will be open soon! #WarwickSummerSchool #WarwickUniversity #SummerAtWarwick

Will you be joining us on 16th September for the International Research Culture Conference 2024? Our in-person registrations are fully booked but you still have until 30th August to register for an online place. https://lnkd.in/eVE5yqEK Take a look at this video from IRCC 2023, where we explored what research culture could look like in 5 years‚Äô time. #IRCC24 #researchculture
